    • Constructor Detail

      • Response

        public Response(Request request,
        HttpURLConnection connection,
        Object body)
        Constructor for a success Reads various fields from the HttpURLConnection
        Parameters:
        request - the HTTP Request that initiated this response
        connection - non-null
        body - may be null (came from connection.getInputStream())

      • Response

        public Response(Request request,
        HttpURLConnection connection,
        IOException ioe,
        int milestoneCode)
        Constructor when there was an IOException
        Parameters:
        request - the HTTP Request that initiated this response
        connection - may be null if connection failed to open.
        ioe - the IOException (non-null)
        milestoneCode - small negative number taken from Request.Milestone

    • Method Detail

      • getContentType

        public String getContentType()
        Content-Type
        Returns:
        String, null if the connection never opened
        See Also:
        URLConnection.getContentType()

      • getHeaderFields

        public Map<String,List<String>> getHeaderFields()
        Return the Headers from the response
        Returns:
        a Map>, null if the connection never opened
        See Also:
        URLConnection.getHeaderFields()

      • getResponseCode

        public int getResponseCode()
        Returns the positive HTTP status code, or else one of Request.Milestone.gerErrorCode() (which are negative)
        Returns:
        int HTTP code, e.g. 200
        See Also:
        HttpURLConnection.getResponseCode(), Request.Milestone.errorCode()

      • getResponseMessage

        public String getResponseMessage()
        Message corresponding to the HTTP status code, or else the message from the IOException
        Returns:
        e.g. "OK"
        See Also:
        HttpURLConnection.getResponseMessage()

      • getBody

        public Object getBody()
        The response data (generally taken from HttpURLConnection.getInputStream())
        Returns:
        Object, never null, but may be ""

      • getURL

        public URL getURL()
        The URL we talked to
        Returns:
        URL
        See Also:
        URLConnection.getURL()

      • getIOException

        public IOException getIOException()
        If there was an IOException, return it here
        Returns:
        the IOException (or null)

      • responseGroup

        public int responseGroup()
        Which "hundreds" the response was in, e.g. good responses are 200
        Returns:
        a multiple of 100
